[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 19:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/d1c91947fbcbd4c636189d1f3e9aea21c2ff49ed', 'message': "Fix stacking failure on RHEL7

Error on unset variable causes an exit. In the script, we are assigning
a default value, if the variable is not already set. So, we can drop
the '-u' option for 'set' command, which exits the stacking process, if
used as 'set -ue'

Change-Id: I69fcd7f60b2a47843fae7573322351711bbf300d
Closes-Bug: #1543749
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stacking failure on RHEL7

Error on unset variable causes an exit. In the script, we are assigning
a default value, if the variable is not already set. So, we can drop
the '-u' option for 'set' command, which exits the stacking process, if
used as 'set -ue'

Change-Id: I69fcd7f60b2a47843fae7573322351711bbf300d
Closes-Bug: #1543749
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/62/278062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(suro-patz): set -exu fails on RHEL7. Thus ommiting -u. set -ex
deleted_lines: set -exu

commit_message:
Fix vfd mount for capitalized device name

This patch enables virtual media deploy even if the expected virtual
floppy device name "/dev/disk/by-label/ir-vfd-dev" is capitalized to
"/dev/disk/by-label/IR-VFD-DEV".
This change is necessary because some bare metal hardware such as
FUJITSU RX1330 series create the capitalized virtual floppy device
name.

Change-Id: I436b3f9524a83814e082f8dd421df3e53b33f792
Closes-Bug: #1541167

commit_message:
Ensure ceilometer-polling is installed for vmware_compute

Since the vmware_compute install process is quite different
from typical compute node deployment, this package gets missed
during deploy time. The ceilometer-polling package needs to be
called in compute_vmware.pp manifests.

Change-Id: If84e1cc388e3adda54ae63bdb4901e013ea14e3f
Closes-Bug: #1537403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/77/277877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: package { 'ceilometer-polling': ensure => latest, name => $::ceilometer::params::agent_polling_package_name, } Package['ceilometer-polling'] -> Service['ceilometer-polling']

commit_message:
devstack: Source ovs devstack lib later.

Source lib/ovs from Neutron just before we need it.  Previously, we were
sourcing it before Neutron may have been installed, causing our devstack
plugin to fail.

Change-Id: If42cd64bc3ebd3a5c851049818b8ae0ca301704a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Missing daemonize for master node

We use daemonize to run puppet. For some tasks (for example, to generate keys) we need
to run puppet on master node.

Change-Id: I21737b28b1a06451569e00cb3762248ff02804c6
Closes-Bug: #1543720

commit_message:
Clean uploading volume when c-vol restarts

This patch is to clean up the state of uploading volumes to
original status when volume service restarts.

Change-Id: I0f49261f11efff835fa2e173bab5c823ca8d7d6e
Closes-bug: #1541175

commit_message:
process pypi flag for release announcements

When tagging a release, look for a flag telling us whether to include
the PyPI link in release announcements and save the information to the
tag message.

When announcing a release, look for the flag and only include the PyPI
link when it is set to yes.

Change-Id: I8e0a2517d2a8c19381d2d57600da92c954775e5e
Depends-On: I491fb9e6edd57a3ec1c0b85c8dd9e22d5f09e6b2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/69/276469/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Determine whether announcements should include a PyPI # link. Default to no, for service projects, because it is # less irksome to fail to include a link to a thing that # exists than to link to something that does not. include_pypi_link = deliverable_data.get( 'include-pypi-link', 'no', ) send_announcements_to, include_pypi_link)
deleted_lines: send_announcements_to)

commit_message:
Add extension fields on network and port create

Add extension fields to the response on network and port create.
This patch set is based on [1] which calls for each core plugin
to apply similar logic to support extensions that rely on
extend_dict functions. For the OVN plugin, this applies to the
network_availability_zone extension for networks and the
extra_dhcp_opt extension for ports.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/276219/

Change-Id: I2fa69102ec3562a818fdf9b18f319da7981e4bf5
Closes-Bug: #1541774
Related-Bug: #1539274
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/44/277844/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add status 'N/A' in Port tables

The lacked of 'N/A' status triger a KeyValue exception when interate
this kind of port.

Change-Id: Id6d4b69a20cd614a13d3a2b817e723249328ffda
Closes-bug: 1539358
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/60/273860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ("N/A", pgettext_lazy("current status of port", u"N/A")),

added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2014-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP wait_for_exit = True wait_for_exit = True # wait for a couple seconds to give the subprocesses a chance to shut down correctly. if wait_for_exit: time.sleep(2) if signum == signal.SIGTERM: sys.exit(0) clean_exit(signal.SIGKILL)

commit_message:
Make Sahara cluster group type idempotent

Node groups parameter is an array with random element order.
Hence it requires custom implementation for comparison between existing
and expected states.

Change-Id: I016352003db9adbd183067aa0e7548c39c368723
Closes-bug: #1526882
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/57/273557/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def insync?(is) if is.count != should.count return false end def get_node_group_by_id(ar,id) ar.each do |ng| if ng["node_group_template_id"] == id return ng end end end equal = true should.each do |should_node| is_node = get_node_group_by_id(is,should_node["node_group_template_id"]) if is_node should_node.each do |key,value| if value.to_s != is_node[key].to_s equal = false end end else equal = false end end return equal end

subject: HA for DVR - Neutron Server side code changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-19 19:55:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1ab1492df74a4d9d03f7093fe3b3e5e066f218dc', 'message': 'HA for DVR - Neutron Server side WIP code

This patch adds HA support for DVR centralized default SNAT
functionality to Neutron Server. For the agent side changes
another patch has been proposed.

Salient changes here are:

 - Allocate and de-allocate HA network resources when SNAT is
   created or removed
 - Schedule/de-schedule SNAT on multiple agents
 - extend Schema and methods to support one router to many snat
   service agents.

This is a WIP, will be adding more code in subsequent patches.

Partial-bug: #1365473

Change-Id: I6a19481d0e19b8a55f32199a27057bf777548b33

 - Allocate and de-allocate HA network resources when SNAT is
   created or removed
 - Schedule/de-schedule SNAT on multiple agents
 - Allow conversion of a legacy router to DVR even if HA is
   enabled on the legacy router
 - Enables
    'router-create <router name> --ha True --distributed True'
 - For an existing legacy router with ha, enables
    'router-update <router name> --distributed True'

Partial-bug: #1365473

Co-Authored-By: Adolfo Duarte <adolfo.duarte@hp.com>
Change-Id: I6a19481d0e19b8a55f32199a27057bf777548b33

"}, {'number': 49, 'created': '2015-09-25 22:32:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2bf1c4eeb96950cb5da312c20cef8eb7049d9ced', 'message': "HA for DVR - Neutron Server side code changes

This patch adds HA support for DVR centralized default SNAT
functionality to Neutron Server. For the agent side changes
another patch has been proposed.

Salient changes here are:

 - Allocate and de-allocate HA network resources when SNAT is
   created or removed
 - Schedule/de-schedule SNAT on multiple agents
 - Enables
    'router-create <router name> --ha True --distributed True'

Partial-bug: #1365473

Co-Authored-By: Adolfo Duarte <adolfo.duarte@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hardik Italia <hardik.italia@hp.com>
Change-Id: I6a19481d0e19b8a55f32199a27057bf777548b33

commit_message:
HA for DVR - Neutron Server side code changes

This patch adds HA support for DVR centralized default SNAT
functionality to Neutron Server. For the agent side changes
another patch has been merged.

Salient changes here are:

 - Schedule/de-schedule SNAT on multiple agents
 - Enables
    'router-create <router name> --ha True --distributed True'

Closes-bug: #1365473

Co-Authored-By: Adolfo Duarte <adolfo.duarte@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hardik Italia <hardik.italia@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I6a19481d0e19b8a55f32199a27057bf777548b33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/69/143169/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import l3_dvr_db from neutron.db import l3_dvrscheduler_db as l3_dvrsch_db from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) #class L3_HA_scheduler_db_mixin(l3_sch_db.L3AgentSchedulerDbMixin): class L3_HA_scheduler_db_mixin(l3_dvrsch_db.L3_DVRsch_db_mixin): def schedule_snat_router(self, context, router_id, sync_router): """Schedule the snat router on l3 service agent.""" is_ha = sync_router['ha'] LOG.debug("SCHED from HA: is_ha %s", is_ha) if is_ha: router_db = self._get_router(context, router_id) router_dict = self._make_router_dict(router_db) LOG.debug("SCHED from HA: router_dict %s", router_dict) active_l3_agents = self.get_l3_agents(context, active=True) snat_candidates = self.get_snat_candidates(sync_router, active_l3_agents) ha_network = self.get_ha_network(context, sync_router['tenant_id']) if not ha_network: ha_network = self._create_ha_network(context, sync_router['tenant_id']) self._set_vr_id(context, router_db, ha_network) for chosen_agent in snat_candidates: port_binding = self.add_ha_port(context.elevated(), router_id, ha_network.network.id, sync_router['tenant_id']) port_binding.l3_agent_id = chosen_agent['id'] c_agent = self.bind_snat_servicenode( context, router_id, [chosen_agent]) self.bind_dvr_router_servicenode( context, router_id, chosen_agent) else: super(L3_HA_scheduler_db_mixin, self).schedule_snat_router(context, router_id, sync_router) def unbind_snat_servicenode(self, context, router_id): """Unbind the snat router to the chosen l3 service agent.""" self.remove_router_from_ha_network(context, router_id) super(L3_HA_scheduler_db_mixin, self).unbind_snat_servicenode(context, router_id)
deleted_lines: class L3_HA_scheduler_db_mixin(l3_sch_db.L3AgentSchedulerDbMixin):

commit_message:
Fixing app cleanup for trigger tests

Change-Id: I71e3ed886520d4136d390149c14a6fb1f5508785
Closes-Bug: #1541124
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/41/274941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_trigger_post(self): resp = self.client.create_app() resp = self.client.create_app() bdy = json.loads(resp.body) trigger_uri = bdy['trigger_uri']
deleted_lines: import yamlfrom functionaltests.api.common import apputils assembly_data = {'name': 'test_assembly', 'description': 'desc assembly'} plan_data = {'version': '1', 'name': 'test_plan', 'artifacts': [], 'description': 'A test to create plan'} def _create_assembly(self): plan_uuid, trigger_uri = self._create_plan() assembly_data['plan_uri'] = "%s/v1/plans/%s" % (self.client.base_url, plan_uuid) data = json.dumps(assembly_data) resp, body = self.client.post('v1/assemblies', data) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 201) out_data = json.loads(body) uuid = out_data['uuid'] self.assertIsNotNone(uuid) return uuid, plan_uuid, trigger_uri def _create_plan(self): data = yaml.dump(plan_data) resp, body = self.client.post( 'v1/plans', data, headers={'content-type': 'application/x-yaml'}) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 201) out_data = yaml.load(body) uuid = out_data['uuid'] trigger_uri = out_data['trigger_uri'] self.assertIsNotNone(uuid) self.assertIsNotNone(trigger_uri) return uuid, trigger_uri def _create_app(self): data = apputils.get_sample_data() resp = self.client.create_app(data=data) return trigger_uri def test_trigger_post(self): trigger_uri = self._create_app() assembly_uuid, plan_uuid, trigger_uri = self._create_assembly() self._delete_assembly(assembly_uuid, plan_uuid) def _delete_assembly(self, assembly_uuid, plan_uuid): resp, body = self.client.delete('v1/assemblies/%s' % assembly_uuid) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 204) self.assertTrue(self.client.assembly_delete_done(assembly_uuid)) self._delete_plan(plan_uuid) def _delete_plan(self, plan_uuid): resp, body = self.client.delete( 'v1/plans/%s' % plan_uuid, headers={'content-type': 'application/x-yaml'}) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 202)

commit_message:
docs: Update README.md to point to new Beaker URL

The URL [1] to the docs for writing Beaker tests (specifically beaker-rspec)
have moved. The README.md still points to the old URL. This commit fixes
this by pointing to a better URL [2].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/wiki/How-to-Write-a-Beaker-Test-for-a-Module

[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker-rspec/blob/master/README.md

Change-Id: Ia6b7db5621d69a4ffc893156d0ee40739cc195f4

subject: mock time.sleep in Broadcom unit test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 22:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/zonemanager/test_brcd_http_fc_zone_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/4de6d18195ebcb3ead9a2cb03adeef36c0ef3a7b', 'message': 'mock time.sleep in Broadcom unit test

TestBrcdHttpFCZoneClient.test_post_zone_data() invokes
BrcdHTTPFCZoneClient.post_zone_data(), which in turn
has a loop around its connect() method inside which there
is a sleep().  Without time.sleep() mocked out, the test
runs 7s on my laptop.

This change mocks out time.sleep() in the test so that
it now runs in .6s.

Change-Id: Ib4c3a12b048a68d2c2db722c089eb04dd7d8c8ef
'}]
commit_message:
mock time.sleep in Broadcom unit test

TestBrcdHttpFCZoneClient.test_post_zone_data() invokes
BrcdHTTPFCZoneClient.post_zone_data(), which in turn
has a loop around its connect() method inside which there
is a sleep().  Without time.sleep() mocked out, the test
runs 7s on my laptop.

This change mocks out time.sleep() in the test so that
it now runs in .6s.

Change-Id: Ib4c3a12b048a68d2c2db722c089eb04dd7d8c8ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/52/275952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time @patch.object(time, 'sleep') def test_post_zone_data(self, connect_mock, sleep_mock):
deleted_lines: def test_post_zone_data(self, connect_mock):

commit_message:
Adding check/recover actions to cluster nodes

This patch adds node check and recover into the cluster service.

Implements: blueprint support-health-management-customization

Change-Id: I4a756f6e5ca63dbd82e0803d66184a53f6a9dcf0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/48/273848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack import utils def _action(self, session, body): """Procedure the invoke an action API. :param session: A session object used for sending request. :param body: The body of action to be sent. """ url = utils.urljoin(self.base_path, self.id, 'actions') resp = session.post(url, endpoint_filter=self.service, json=body) return resp.json def check(self, session, **params): """An action procedure for the node to check its health status. :param session: A session object used for sending request. :returns: A dictionary containing the action ID. """ body = { 'check': params } return self._action(session, body) def recover(self, session, **params): """An action procedure for the node to recover. :param session: A session object used for sending request. :returns: A dictionary containing the action ID. """ body = { 'recover': params } return self._action(session, body)

commit_message:
docs: Update README.md to point to new Beaker URL

The URL [1] to the docs for writing Beaker tests (specifically beaker-rspec)
have moved. The README.md still points to the old URL. This commit fixes
this by pointing to a better URL [2].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/wiki/How-to-Write-a-Beaker-Test-for-a-Module

[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker-rspec/blob/master/README.md

Change-Id: I52d1f03f2f55a9fc7e2a8420da16889f81608418

commit_message:
MonApi should not use DBI metrics with hibernate

This commit fixes issue spotted by commit
d698088116bf5a517800139ee8451b2a43aed026.
MonApi detection plugin no longer assumes
that Java implementation of monasca-api runs
on monitored machine. In such way _is_hibernate_on
is immune if api_config was not set.

Change-Id: Ibac7c8993c9c0a8eab75191b01918fb28d666202
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/57/277757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "type": "gauge" }, "type": "gauge" }, "type": "rate" } if not self._is_hibernate_on(): # if hibernate is not used, it is mysql with DBI # for that case having below entries makes sense log.debug('MonApi has not enabled Hibernate, adding DBI metrics') whitelist.extend([ { "name": "raw-sql.time.avg", "path": "timers/org.skife.jdbi.v2.DBI.raw-sql/mean", "type": "gauge" }, { "name": "raw-sql.time.max", "path": "timers/org.skife.jdbi.v2.DBI.raw-sql/max", "type": "gauge" } ]) config.merge(dropwizard_metrics('monitoring', 'monasca-api', 'http://localhost:8081/metrics', whitelist)) def _is_hibernate_on(self): # check if api_config has been declared in __init__ # if not it means that configuration file was not found # or monasca-api Python implementation is running api_config = getattr(self, 'api_config', None) if api_config is None: return False hibernate_cfg = self.api_config.get('hibernate', None) if hibernate_cfg is None: return False return hibernate_cfg.get('supportEnabled', False)
deleted_lines: "type": "gauge"}, "type": "gauge"}, "type": "rate"}, { "name": "raw-sql.time.avg", "path": "timers/org.skife.jdbi.v2.DBI.raw-sql/mean", "type": "gauge"}, { "name": "raw-sql.time.max", "path": "timers/org.skife.jdbi.v2.DBI.raw-sql/max", "type": "gauge"}, config.merge(dropwizard_metrics('monitoring', 'monasca-api', 'http://localhost:8081/metrics', whitelist))

commit_message:
Expose RPC response timeout as a puppet parameter.

For some deployments (multi-DC) being able to increase the response
timeout for heat RPC's is vital.

Change-Id: Ib6a61e01ba9879315f9283c4fae34873ce89d338
(cherry picked from commit 46cda612de1f575623d66bd72563f0586e2b3540)

commit_message:
pxc grow/shrink cluster implementation

* The adds support for pxc to grow a cluster.
* api and taskmanager support for shrinking a cluster
* validate that the networks given are the same for each instance in
  the cluster.
* make sure to add the existing networks on an instance in the
  cluster.
* add new Error task for grow and shrink.
* nova client version configuration changed to a string option rather
  than an int option because the nova microversions change nova api
  output. This was needed for the network interfaces on existing
  instances.
* testing for grow and shrink cluster

Change-Id: I8602cad1a98970fcd99ee9793a89e1abdceb0982
Partially-Implements-Blueprint: pxc-grow-shrink-cluster

Here we load the fake driver cfg.CONF.set_override( 'drivers', ['congress.tests.fake_datasource.FakeDataSource']) self.table_model = table_model.TableModel('api-table', policy_engine='engine') self.api_rule = rule_model.RuleModel('api-rule', policy_engine='engine') self.api_policy = policy_model.PolicyModel('api-policy', policy_engine='engine') result = api_base.setup_config([self.table_model, self.api_rule, self.api_policy]) self.node = result['node'] self.engine = result['engine'] self.data = result['data'] def tearDown(self): super(TestTableModel, self).tearDown() self.node.stop() self.node.wait() def test_get_datasource_table_with_id(self): context = {'ds_id': self.data.service_id, 'table_id': 'fake_table'} expected_ret = {'id': 'fake_table'} ret = self.table_model.get_item('fake_table', {}, context) self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) def test_get_datasource_table_with_name(self): context = {'ds_id': self.data.service_id, 'table_id': 'fake_table'} expected_ret = {'id': 'fake_table'} ret = self.table_model.get_item('fake_table', {}, context) self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) # def test_get_policy_table(self): # context = {'policy_id': self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY, # 'table_id': 'p'} # expected_ret = {'id': 'p'} # # self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'p(x) :- q(x)'}, {}, context=context) # self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'q(x) :- r(x)'}, {}, context=context) # # ret = self.table_model.get_item('p', {}, context) # self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) # def test_get_invalid_policy(self): # context = {'policy_id': self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY, # 'table_id': 'fake-table'} # invalid_context = {'policy_id': 'invalid-policy', # 'table_id': 'fake-table'} # expected_ret = None # self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'p(x) :- q(x)'}, {}, context=context) # self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'q(x) :- r(x)'}, {}, context=context) # # ret = self.table_model.get_item(self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY, # {}, invalid_context) # self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) # def test_get_invalid_policy_table(self): # self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'q(x) :- r(x)'}, {}, context=context) # ret = self.table_model.get_item(self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY, {}, # invalid_context) # self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret)""" def test_get_items_datasource_table(self): context = {'ds_id': self.data.service_id} expected_ret = {'results': [{'id': 'fake_table'}]} ret = self.table_model.get_items({}, context) self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) """ def test_get_items_invalid_datasource(self): context = {'ds_id': 'invalid-id', 'table_id': 'fake-table'} ret = self.table_model.get_items({}, context) self.assertIsNone(ret) def _get_id_list_from_return(self, result): return [r['id'] for r in result['results']] def test_get_items_policy_table(self): context = {'policy_id': self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY} expected_ret = {'results': [{'id': x} for x in ['q', 'p', 'r']]} self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'p(x) :- q(x)'}, {}, context=context) self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'q(x) :- r(x)'}, {}, context=context) ret = self.table_model.get_items({}, context) self.assertEqual(set(self._get_id_list_from_return(expected_ret)), set(self._get_id_list_from_return(ret))) def test_get_items_invalid_policy(self): context = {'policy_id': self.engine.DEFAULT_THEORY} invalid_context = {'policy_id': 'invalid-policy'} expected_ret = None self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'p(x) :- q(x)'}, {}, context=context) self.api_rule.add_item({'rule': 'q(x) :- r(x)'}, {}, context=context) ret = self.table_model.get_items({}, invalid_context) self.assertEqual(expected_ret, ret) """

commit_message:
Move common functionalities to base APIModel

This commit adds new file base.py which holds the common
functionalities w.r.t API models.
1. Checking for distributed Architecture here instead of all api_models
2. Move rpc calling to base, which can be used by all api models.

All api models can be made to inherit from this base api class to
reuse the functionality and with minimal changes to all other api models.

Change-Id: I4d6336a4048845143e3ade2454a0f7f2d82aba52

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 NEC Corporation. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """ Base class for all API models.""" from __future__ import absolute_import from oslo_config import cfg # Use new deepsix when appropriate if (hasattr(cfg.CONF, 'distributed_architecture') and cfg.CONF.distributed_architecture): from congress.dse2 import deepsix2 as deepsix else: from congress.dse import deepsix from congress import exception class APIModel(deepsix.deepSix): """Base Class for handling API requests.""" def __init__(self, name, keys='', inbox=None, dataPath=None, policy_engine=None, datasource_mgr=None): super(APIModel, self).__init__(name, keys, inbox=inbox, dataPath=dataPath) self.engine = policy_engine self.datasource_mgr = datasource_mgr self.distributed_architecture = False if cfg.CONF.distributed_architecture and hasattr(self, 'dse2'): self.distributed_architecture = True def invoke_rpc(self, caller, name, kwargs): if self.distributed_architecture: self.rpc(caller, name, kwargs) else: func = getattr(caller, name, None) if func: return func(**kwargs) raise exception.CongressException('method: %s is not defined in %s' % (name, caller.__name__))

commit_message:
Migrate rule_model to Dse2

Most of the old tests work, but created a copy in tests2
so that (i) could properly initialize the 'action' policy
(ii) could comment out the tests that do not currently
work.

See TODO(dse2) for more explanations for why tests do not
yet work.

To run the new tests (they are not at this time run by gate):
python3 -m "nose" congress/tests2/

Implements: blueprint dist-integrate-new-dse
Change-Id: I01065dc6527585fbd16e2a74fa4f770d44391976

commit_message:
[TEST] Remove restricted & multiverse components from Ubuntu sources

re: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086000.html

Ubuntu has 4 different 'components' - main, universe, multiverse and
restricted:
 - Main: Officially supported software.
 - Restricted: Supported software that is not available under a completely
               free license.
 - Universe: Community maintained software, i.e. not officially supported
             software.
 - Multiverse: Software that is not free.

Practically speaking there should be nothing particularly useful to
OpenStack-Ansible in Restricted or Multiverse - it's mostly software for
desktop users.

This patch removes the configuration of the unnecessary components.

Change-Id: Id993f6cbce06ca2c1f9a5dd6f4a324eb019a5aa8

commit_message:
Add bashate E040 exception

As many scripts are deployed as templates and use use jinja templating,
this will often fail. This test is reasonably safely ignored as the
syntax error will be identified when executing the resulting script.

Change-Id: If0be1b40c4bc547ea63347370b4d4421ac77f40e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/47/277747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006,E040"
deleted_lines: {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006"

commit_message:
More efficient implementation of find_dependent_nodes

New implementation of find_dependent_nodes that builds a copy graph with
all edges reversed, then invoking find_reachable_nodes.

Rationale:

From original comment:
TODO(thinrichs): is it equivalent/better to invert all the edges
and run depth-first-search?

I believe inverting then dfs is better.

Inverting first then dfs: each edge examined twice

Current implementation: each edge examined the number of times the
`while changed` loop is executed, which is usually at least twice,
up to the number of nodes in the worst case (e.g., linear graph, worst case
`for node in self.edges` order).

Change-Id: I1ad772fb1f9732b89d13896dbe84278c6c4fd39c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/79/276979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_find_dependent_nodes(self): g1 = utility.Graph() self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([1]), set([1])) g1.add_edge(0, 1) g1.add_edge(1, 2) g1.add_edge(2, 3) g1.add_edge(2, 4) g1.add_edge(3, 5) g1.add_edge(0, 6) g1.add_edge(7, 8) g1.add_edge(8, 9) g1.add_edge(10, 5) g1.add_edge(11, 12) self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([0]), set([0])) self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([2]), set([2, 1, 0])) self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([5]), set([5, 0, 1, 2, 3, 10])) self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([12]), set([11, 12])) self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([5, 6]), set([5, 0, 1, 2, 3, 10, 6])) g1.add_edge(5, 2) # add cycle self.assertEqual(g1.find_dependent_nodes([2]), set([5, 0, 1, 2, 3, 10]))

commit_message:
Fix find_reachable_nodes bug on empty set roots

Changed depth_first_search so that empty set @roots param is not
confused with None @roots param.

Tests added.

Patchset 1 exhibits the bug.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/276952/1/

Closes-Bug: #1542537

Change-Id: I480068f7227b3608645b16b2fbccb2e9cc00c2b5

commit_message:
Hitachi HNAS driver share shrink

This patch adds the share shrink feature to Hitachi HNAS driver.

Change-Id: I6d0318228955e0be95c650c9db331d383c2d0a05
Implements: blueprint hitachi-hnas-driver-share-shrink
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/34/265434/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def shrink_share(self, share, new_size, share_server=None): """Shinks a share to new size. :param share: Share that will be shrinked. :param new_size: New size of share. :param share_server: Data structure with share server information. Not used by this driver. """ share_id = self._get_hnas_share_id(share['id']) LOG.debug("Shrinking share in HNAS: %(shr_id)s.", {'shr_id': six.text_type(share['id'])}) if share['share_proto'].lower() != 'nfs': msg = _("Only NFS protocol is currently supported.") raise exception.ShareBackendException(msg=msg) self._shrink_share(share_id, share['size'], new_size) LOG.info(_LI("Share %(shr_id)s successfully shrinked to " "%(shr_size)s."), {'shr_id': six.text_type(share['id']), 'shr_size': six.text_type(new_size)}) def _shrink_share(self, share_id, old_size, new_size): """Shrinks a share to new size. :param share_id: ID of share that will be shrinked. :param old_size: Current size of share that will be shrinked. :param new_size: New size of share after shrink operation. """ self._ensure_share(share_id) usage = self.hnas.get_share_usage(share_id) LOG.debug("Usage space in share %(share)sG: %(usage)sG", {'share': share_id, 'usage': usage}) if new_size > usage: self.hnas.shrink_quota(share_id, new_size) else: raise exception.ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss(share_id=share_id)

commit_message:
Optimize API gate devstack build time

Our API test gates (including minimal) are loading services
that are not needed for these tests.  This patch disables the
additional services that are not needed for these tests.

Change-Id: Ibce11e21637643e66f145d8d7f31c7b63bd83f7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/19/274319/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Not needed for API tests ENABLED_SERVICES+="-horizon,-ceilometer-acentral,-ceilometer-acompute," ENABLED_SERVICES+="-ceilometer-alarm-evaluator,-ceilometer-alarm-notifier," ENABLED_SERVICES+="-ceilometer-anotification,-ceilometer-api," ENABLED_SERVICES+="-ceilometer-collector,"

commit_message:
New filter for metrics-threshold-scheduling

If metrics monitor framework is enabled, HVs report utilization
metrics periodically via resource tracker. Using these data from
compute_nodes table, we can take scheduling decision based on the
thresholds defined per metrics.

Change-Id: I0162c2d7991b1040cce6fb24a057a09268d623a9
Implements: blueprint metrics-threshold-filter

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import objects from nova.objects import fields from nova.scheduler.filters import metrics_threshold_filter from nova import test from nova.tests.unit.scheduler import fakes from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from oslo_utils import timeutils ts_now = timeutils.utcnow() cpu_user_percent_metric = { 'name': fields.MonitorMetricType.CPU_USER_PERCENT, 'value': 0.3, 'timestamp': ts_now.isoformat(), 'source': 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver' } cpu_percent_metric = { 'name': fields.MonitorMetricType.CPU_PERCENT, 'value': 0.6, 'timestamp': ts_now.isoformat(), 'source': 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver' } spec_list = [cpu_user_percent_metric, cpu_percent_metric] def set_spec_list_value(a, b): spec_list[0]['value'] = a spec_list[1]['value'] = b class TestMetricsThresholdFilter(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_metrics_threshold_filter_no_metric(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5', 'cpu.user.percent=0.4'], group='metrics') metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json(jsonutils.dumps([])) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertTrue(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_no_thres(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=[], group='metrics') metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json(jsonutils.dumps( [cpu_percent_metric])) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertTrue(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_below_thres(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5'], group='metrics') cpu_percent_metric['value'] = 0.4 metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json(jsonutils.dumps( [cpu_percent_metric])) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertTrue(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_metric_thres_mismatch(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5'], group='metrics') metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json( jsonutils.dumps([cpu_user_percent_metric])) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertTrue(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_above_thres(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5'], group='metrics') cpu_percent_metric['value'] = 0.6 metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json(jsonutils.dumps( [cpu_percent_metric])) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertFalse(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_one_metric_above_thres(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5', 'cpu.user.percent=0.4'], group='metrics') set_spec_list_value(0.3, 0.6) metrics = objects.MonitorMetricList.from_json( jsonutils.dumps(spec_list)) host = fakes.FakeHostState('host1', 'node1', attribute_dict={'metrics': metrics}) filt_cls = metrics_threshold_filter.MetricsThresholdFilter() self.assertFalse(filt_cls.host_passes(host, None)) def test_metrics_threshold_filter_all_metric_below_thres(self): self.flags(metrics_thresholds=['cpu.percent=0.5', 'cpu.user.percent=0.4'], group='metrics') set_spec_list_value(0.3, 0.4) metrics = commit_message:
Update .mailmap

This commit updates and sorts the .mailmap file for top 30th
contributors. I picked up the latest author names and emails from the
commit log.
The .mailmap feature is used to coalesce together commits by the same
person in the shortlog, where their name and/or email address was
spelled differently[1].

[1] https://git-scm.com/docs/git-shortlog

Change-Id: Ibc28a0b4f5839df9e6cd7df156ed818300312acd

commit_message:
Create cloud update command

Support serializing the cloud config we have loaded (possibly from
environment variables) into a clouds.yaml format. This is especially
useful if you would like to consume a stackrc and create a clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: I4772df4b8c194619391893b835812d35e8de1d19
Depends-On: Ia185847c29c10f2cc6838adf962defd80894d0db

commit_message:
Do not always require user parameters

Only require user to pass parameters if user wants to deploy translated
template with Heat. For now by default deploy option is set to false as
the work to allow  user to automatically deploy is still in progress.
The current changes makes it flexble and allows user to provide parameters
at the time of manual deployment with heat instead of forcefully provding
them during translation.

Closes-Bug: 1541518
Partially Implements: blueprint handle-cli-user-input

Change-Id: Iea7e704d045f56eb758892ff4f73d9357d718857

commit_message:
Move EC2 extension to core

Move the EC2 extension to core.

If the keystone.compat.aws.ec2._ec3_core module is removed due to
legal concerns that some deployers have, the EC2 Router will
instead use a controller that simply raises HTTP 403 (forbidden)
for all calls. This allows the legal concerns around the EC2 APIs
to be addressed in the same manner (for the orgs that require no
EC2 API compat code to be present on the disk for the OpenStack
deployment).

Change-Id: I26dfcbfc574eb954577a2bfe73e8a0604331118f
bp: extensions-to-core

added_lines: from oslo_log import log from oslo_log import versionutils LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class Ec2Extension(wsgi.Middleware): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(Ec2Extension, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) msg = _("Remove ec2_extension from the paste pipeline, the " "s3 extension is now always available. Update the " "[pipeline:admin_api], and " "[pipeline:public_api] sections in keystone-paste.ini " "accordingly, as it will be removed in the O release.") versionutils.report_deprecated_feature(LOG, msg) class Ec2ExtensionV3(wsgi.Middleware): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(Ec2ExtensionV3, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) msg = _("Remove ec2_extension_v3 from the paste pipeline, the " "s3 extension is now always available. Update the " "[pipeline:api_v3] section in keystone-paste.ini " "accordingly, as it will be removed in the O release.") versionutils.report_deprecated_feature(LOG, msg)
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation #import functools from keystone.common import json_homefrom keystone.contrib.ec2 import controllers build_resource_relation = functools.partial( json_home.build_v3_extension_resource_relation, extension_name='OS-EC2', extension_version='1.0') class Ec2Extension(wsgi.ExtensionRouter): def add_routes(self, mapper): ec2_controller = controllers.Ec2Controller() # validation mapper.connect( '/ec2tokens', controller=ec2_controller, action='authenticate', conditions=dict(method=['POST'])) # crud mapper.connect( '/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2', controller=ec2_controller, action='create_credential', conditions=dict(method=['POST'])) mapper.connect( '/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2', controller=ec2_controller, action='get_credentials', conditions=dict(method=['GET'])) mapper.connect( '/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2/{credential_id}', controller=ec2_controller, action='get_credential', conditions=dict(method=['GET'])) mapper.connect( '/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2/{credential_id}', controller=ec2_controller, action='delete_credential', conditions=dict(method=['DELETE'])) class Ec2ExtensionV3(wsgi.V3ExtensionRouter): def add_routes(self, mapper): ec2_controller = controllers.Ec2ControllerV3() # validation self._add_resource( mapper, ec2_controller, path='/ec2tokens', post_action='authenticate', rel=build_resource_relation(resource_name='ec2tokens')) # crud self._add_resource( mapper, ec2_controller, path='/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2', get_action='ec2_list_credentials', post_action='ec2_create_credential', rel=build_resource_relation(resource_name='user_credentials'), path_vars={ 'user_id': json_home.Parameters.USER_ID, }) self._add_resource( mapper, ec2_controller, path='/users/{user_id}/credentials/OS-EC2/{credential_id}', get_action='ec2_get_credential', delete_action='ec2_delete_credential', rel=build_resource_relation(resource_name='user_credential'), path_vars={ 'credential_id': json_home.build_v3_parameter_relation('credential_id'), 'user_id': json_home.Parameters.USER_ID, })
